questions.question_text: The amplitude, A, and the period, P, of the function ( )3( ) sin 22fx x π = −− are
questions.detailed_answer: The function is f(x) = 3 sin (2π (x - 2)). Amplitude A = 3. Period P = 2π / 2π = 2.

questions.detailed_answer: For infinite solutions, lines coincide. Solve for gradients equal, m + 1/3 = -3/(m - 1), leads to m^2 - 1 = 0, m = ±1. questions.question_text: The maximal interval over which the graph of 3293()84gx x x x= +− is strictly decreasing is
questions.detailed_answer: g'(x) = 3x^2 + 29x - 84 = 3(x + 11)(x - 4), critical points x = -11, x = 4. g' < 0 on [-11, 4], strictly decreasing on [-11, 4].
